alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 4:28AM HST until July 19 at 9:15AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 730 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 417 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over windward portions of Maui, especially over the slopes from Paia to Hana and the West Maui Mountains. Water levels continue to rise in the streams over much of the island, especially in the Hanawi stream. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Runoff impacting vulnerable low-lying areas and roads is possible through the early morning hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kahului, Kihei, Lahaina, Kula, Pukalani, Makawao, Keokea, Haliimaile, Paia, Puunene, Haiku-Pauwela, Wailea, Pauwela, Maalaea, Ulupalakua, Huelo, Makena, Waikapu, Wailuku and Waiehu. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 730 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. A Flood Watch for the entire island of Maui remains in effect until 6 PM HST today.
